info.author: Johannes Erwerle
info.description:
# rcon-server
A implementation of the RCON protocol on the server side.

# Why do you need an RCON server implementation?

rcon-server is primarily designed as a tool for testing, e.g. with unit tests.
Installing, running, updating, etc a regular srcds server might use a lot of
resources.
\>10GB of storage space per server is not uncommon.
Also it is hard to get some results from an server in a test environment.
A server only reports the amount of users which are on the server.
Getting several people on a server for testing is pretty annoying and time
consuming.
rcon-server allows you to implement a function that returns an answer per
command.

# Specification

The RCON Specification can be found here:
[https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Source_RCON_Protocol]

# How to install

~~~
pip install rcon-server
~~~

# how to run the tests:

~~~
cd rcon_server
python3 -m unittest
~~~
info.name: rcon-server
info.summary: a server side implementaiton of the RCON Protocol.
info.html_description:
rcon-server

A implementation of the RCON protocol on the server side.

Why do you need an RCON server implementation?

rcon-server is primarily designed as a tool for testing, e.g. with unit tests. Installing, running, updating, etc a regular srcds server might use a lot of resources. >10GB of storage space per server is not uncommon. Also it is hard to get some results from an server in a test environment. A server only reports the amount of users which are on the server. Getting several people on a server for testing is pretty annoying and time consuming. rcon-server allows you to implement a function that returns an answer per command.

Specification

The RCON Specification can be found here: [https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Source_RCON_Protocol]

How to install

pip install rcon-server

how to run the tests:

cd rcon_server
python3 -m unittest
